name: Tagtagger.js
tagline: jQuery plugin to create and manage tags
body:
## [TagTagger.js](https://github.com/exexzian/TagTagger.js) ============================================================================
TagTagger.js v0.0.1
jQuery plugin to create and manage tags
requires - taggerStyles.css and jquery.js
**For Demo check: ** taggerDemo.html
✦ Create tags on the go - **features**
![Plugin Loaded](http://s20.postimg.org/988lkdx99/plugin_loaded.png) 
✔ Checks for duplicate tags and display fade-In/Out message


		- which makes it less annoying - Message text can be easily changed by passing option msg

		- Want even less annoynance - of course you can pass the showMsg as false
 
![Duplicate Tag Error Message](http://s20.postimg.org/mdo3qhr4t/duplicate_Error_Message.png)
✔ Customization Options

![Tags Added](http://s20.postimg.org/fohkah5st/tags.png)
✔ Editable Tags

![Edit tags](http://s20.postimg.org/4q6asah7h/edit_tag.png)
✔ Option to Finish the tag addition/edition by clicking **Done** button 

![Done Edit button](http://s20.postimg.org/ua8kyq2l9/delete_tag.png)
### Usage: ( Simple as It can be ) ✦ Default mode:
$('elementOrSelector').TagTagger();
✦ Passing Options by overriding Default settings (change as required): 
'box' : {
			'width' : '500px',
			'minHeight' : '90px'
		},
		'tag' : {
			'bgColor' : '#161d6d',
			'fontColor' : '#ffffff'
		},
		'tagProperty' : {
			'minLength' : '1'
		},
		'duplicateMsg' : {
			'showMsg' : 'true',
			'message' : '
         Oooppsss!!!       
Seems You Already Have That Tag. 
',
			'bgColor' : '#e3e18a'
		}
***
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
